info.title: The Zuplo Developer API, powered by Zuplo
info.description:
Welcome to ZAPI - the Zuplo API where you can manage API keys, tunnels and more. To get your API key for this service login to [portal.zuplo.com](https://portal.zuplo.com) and navigate to your project **Settings > Zuplo API Keys.** 


 ![API Keys](https://cdn.zuplo.com/uploads/zuplo-api-keys.png)

tags.name: Deployments
tags.description: Set of operations available to handle deployments. You can learn more about deployments [here](https://zuplo.com/docs/articles/environments).

tags.name: Tunnels
tags.description: List of endpoints available to perform operations on Tunnels.

tags.name: Tunnel Services
tags.description: List of endpoints available to manage services for a given tunnel.

tags.name: Variables
tags.description: Set of operations available to create and update environment variables. You can learn more about environment variables [here](https://zuplo.com/docs/articles/environment-variables).

tags.name: API Keys - Buckets
tags.description: A Bucket is an object representing a group of API key consumers for a given account. This section includes a group of endpoints available to perform CRUD operations on a bucket. You can learn more about buckets [here](https://zuplo.com/docs/articles/api-key-buckets).

tags.name: API Keys - Consumers
tags.description: A Consumer is an object representing a group of API keys in a given bucket. This section includes a group of endpoints available to perform CRUD operations on a consumer. You can learn more about consumers [here](https://zuplo.com/docs/articles/api-key-management#consumers).

tags.name: API Keys - Keys
tags.description: This is an object representing an API key. This section includes a list of endpoints to perform CRUD operations on an API key. You can learn more about API keys [here](https://zuplo.com/docs/articles/api-key-management#api-keys).

get.summary: Gets the provisioning status for the tunnel
get.description: This endpoint returns the status of the services that the tunnel is currently configured for. Provisioning the services is an asynchronous process so this endpoint allows you to poll the status.

get.description: This endpoint returns a snapshot of the services that the tunnel is currently configured for.

put.description: This endpoint reads the request body and creates/updates/delete the services that the tunnel connects to.

get.summary: Gets the teardown provisioning status for the tunnel
get.description: This endpoint returns the status of the deletion of the tunnel. Tearing down the tunnel is an asynchronous process so this endpoint allows you to poll the status.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.BucketParams.bucketName.name: bucketName
Zuplo.ApiKeys.BucketParams.bucketName.description: The name of the bucket. Zuplo automatically creates a bucket for your project. You can find it in youe Zuplo Portal under Settings > Project Information.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.DevPortalBucketParams.buck.name: bucketName
Zuplo.ApiKeys.DevPortalBucketParams.buck.description: The name of the bucket. Zuplo automatically creates a bucket for your project. You can find it in youe Zuplo Portal under Settings > Project Information.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.IncludeApiKeyParam.name: include-api-keys
Zuplo.ApiKeys.IncludeApiKeyParam.description: Include the api key data in the response.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.IncludeManagerInvitesParam.name: include-manager-invites
Zuplo.ApiKeys.IncludeManagerInvitesParam.description: Include the manager invites data in the response.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.IncludeManagerParam.name: include-managers
Zuplo.ApiKeys.IncludeManagerParam.description: Include the manager's data in the response.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.KeyFormatQueryParam.name: key-format
Zuplo.ApiKeys.KeyFormatQueryParam.description:
The format of the key to return.
`none`: Key is completely hidden.
`visible`: Key is completely visible.
`masked`: Part of key suffix is visible.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.ManagerEmailQueryParam.name: manager-email
Zuplo.ApiKeys.ManagerEmailQueryParam.description: Filter by email address of key manager.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.ManagerInviteEmailQueryPar.name: manager-invite-email
Zuplo.ApiKeys.ManagerInviteEmailQueryPar.description: Filter by email address of key manager who haven't accepted the invite yet.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.TagQueryParam.name: tag
Zuplo.ApiKeys.TagQueryParam.description: Query by tag. Example usage is `tag.account=foo`, where `account` is the name of the tag property and `foo` is the value.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.WithApiKeyQueryParam.name: with-api-key
Zuplo.ApiKeys.WithApiKeyQueryParam.description: If an API key should be created with the consumer.

Zuplo.Common.AccountParams.name: accountName
Zuplo.Common.AccountParams.description: The name of the account. You can find this in your Zuplo Portal under Settings > Project Information.

Zuplo.Common.AccountProjectParams.projec.name: projectName
Zuplo.Common.AccountProjectParams.projec.description: The name of the project. You can find this in your Zuplo Portal under Settings > Project Information.

Zuplo.Common.BranchParams.name: branchName
Zuplo.Common.BranchParams.description: The name of the branch in your source control provider.

Zuplo.Common.DeployParams.name: deploymentName
Zuplo.Common.DeployParams.description: The name of the deployment. You can find this in the Zuplo Portal under Settings > Environments.

Zuplo.Common.VariableParams.name: variableName
Zuplo.Common.VariableParams.description: The name of the environment variable.

Zuplo.Tunnels.TunnelTeardownStatusParams.name: operationId
Zuplo.Tunnels.TunnelTeardownStatusParams.description: The ID of the deletion operation.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.ApiKey.description: A Consumer can have any number of API keys associated with it. Each API Key shares the same identity (i.e. Consumer) when authenticating with this service. Keys can have their own description to note the use of the key and can have an expiration date. Expired keys will not be permitted to authenticate after their expiration.

updatedOn.description: When the item was last updated.

description.description: The description of the api key.

key.description: The API key's value. You can use this parameter to override Zuplo's default key format, but this is not recommended as you will lose our [API Key Leak Detection](https://zuplo.com/docs/articles/api-key-leak-detection)

description.description: The description of the api key.

key.description: The API key's value. You can use this parameter to override Zuplo's default key format, but this is not recommended as you will lose our [API Key Leak Detection](https://zuplo.com/docs/articles/api-key-leak-detection)

Zuplo.ApiKeys.Bucket.description: Top level group for API key mangement. A bucket could be used with a single Zuplo environment or shared among multiple environments or projects. By default a Zuplo API Gateway project will be created with several buckets that map to production, preview, and working copy environments.

updatedOn.description: When the item was last updated.

isRetrievable.description: Whether the API keys stored in the bucket are retrievable

name.description: A friendly name for the bucket.

tags.description: Key value pairs to associate with the bucket.

name.description: A friendly name for the bucket.

tags.description: Key value pairs to associate with the bucket.
Key value pairs to associate with the bucket.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.Consumer.description: Consumers are the core of the API Key service. The consumer is the 'identity' of any API Keys that are created.

updatedOn.description: When the item was last updated.

name.description: A friendly name for the consumer. This name is used as the default user.sub property in the API Key Authentication policy.

tags.description: Key value pairs to associate with the consumer.

metadata.description: Generic metadata associated with the consumer.

name.description: A friendly name for the consumer. This name is used as the default user.sub property in the API Key Authentication policy.

managers.description: Email addresses of the managers to add to the consumer.

tags.description: Key value pairs to associate with the consumer.

metadata.description: Generic metadata associated with the consumer.

tags.description: Key value pairs to associate with the consumer.

metadata.description: Generic metadata associated with the consumer.

Zuplo.ApiKeys.Manager.description: Managers are users that have access to a consumer. Managers can be invited to a consumer using the manager-invites endpoint.

email.description: The email address of the manager

sub.description: The sub of the manager in the identity provider

Zuplo.ApiKeys.ManagerInvite.description: Manager invites are used to invite managers to a consumer. The invitation code can be sent to the manager for them to gain access to the consumer.

inviteCode.description: The code to use to accept the invitation

email.description: The email address of the manager to invite

Zuplo.DeploymentStatus.DeploymentStatus.description: Status of a Zuplo project deployment, including the status, build results, and a URL to view more details.

Zuplo.Deployments.Deployment.description: A single deployment of a Zup.

name.description: The name of the deployment. You can find this in the Zuplo Portal under Settings > Environments.

Zuplo.OpenApiRoute.ApiSpec.example: { openapi: 3.0.0, info: { title: The Zuplo Developer API, powered by Zuplo} .... } ,

Zuplo.Tunnels.Tunnel.description: Tunnels allow you to expose services running on bare metal, on-premises, or other non-cloud providers to the Zuplo platform. [Further reading](https://zuplo.com/docs/articles/secure-tunnel).

name.description: A friendly name for the tunnel.

token.description: Set your TUNNEL_TOKEN to this value to connect to the tunnel.

name.description: A friendly name for the tunnel.
A friendly name for the service. This name needs to be unique across all your tunneled services. Changing this will invalidate existing services with the name.

endpoint.description: The URL of the service that the tunnel will forward to, e.g, http://localhost:3000

accessibleBy.description: The environments of the project that should have acess to this tunneled service.

configurations.description: A list of projects that should have access to this tunneled service under the service://name URL scheme.

version.description: The version of this configuration format.

services.description: A list of services that the tunnel will connect to.

updatedOn.description: When the item was last updated.

name.description: The name of the variable. Must be named in SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE.

isSecret.description: Whether the variable is a secret.

name.description: The name of the variable. Must be named in SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE.

isSecret.description: Whether the variable is a secret.
